sc1000.description: $ is not used specially and should therefore be escaped.

sc1001.description: This `\o` will be a regular 'o' in this context.

sc1003.description: Want to escape a single quote? echo 'This is how it'\\''s done'.

sc1004.description: This backslash+linefeed is literal. Break outside single quotes if you just want to break the line.

sc1007.description: Remove space after = if trying to assign a value (or for empty string, use var='' ... ).

sc1008.description: This shebang was unrecognized. ShellCheck only supports sh/bash/dash/ksh. Add a 'shell' directive to specify.

sc1009.description: The mentioned parser error was in ...

sc1010.description: Use semicolon or linefeed before 'done' (or quote to make it literal).

sc1011.description: This apostrophe terminated the single quoted string!

sc1012.description: `\t` is just literal `t` here. For tab, use `"$(printf '\t')"` instead.

sc1014.description: Use 'if cmd; then ..' to check exit code, or 'if [ "$(cmd)" = .. ]' to check output.

sc1015.description: This is a unicode double quote. Delete and retype it.

sc1016.description: This is a Unicode single quote. Delete and retype it.

sc1017.description: Literal carriage return. Run script through `tr -d '\r'` .

sc1018.description: This is a unicode non-breaking space. Delete it and retype as space.

sc1019.description: Expected this to be an argument to the unary condition.

sc1020.description: You need a space before the if single then "]" else "]]"

sc1028.description: In [..] you have to escape \\( \\) or preferably combine [..] expressions.

sc1036.description: `(` is invalid here. Did you forget to escape it?

sc1037.description: Braces are required for positionals over 9, e.g. ${10}.

sc1038.description: Shells are space sensitive. Use '< <(cmd)', not '<<(cmd)'.

sc1039.description: Remove indentation before end token (or use `<<-` and indent with tabs).

sc1040.description: When using <<-, you can only indent with tabs.

sc1041.description: Found 'eof' further down, but not on a separate line.

sc1042.description: Found 'eof' further down, but not on a separate line.

sc1044.description: Couldn't find end token `EOF' in the here document.

sc1048.description: Can't have empty then clauses (use 'true' as a no-op).

sc1049.description: Did you forget the 'then' for this 'if'?

sc1051.description: Semicolons directly after 'then' are not allowed. Just remove it.

sc1052.description: Semicolons directly after 'then' are not allowed. Just remove it.

sc1053.description: Semicolons directly after 'else' are not allowed. Just remove it.

sc1054.description: You need a space after the '{'.

sc1064.description: Expected a { to open the function definition.

sc1065.description: Trying to declare parameters? Don't. Use () and refer to params as $1, $2..

sc1066.description: Don't use $ on the left side of assignments.

sc1067.description: For indirection, use arrays, `declare "var$n=value"`, or (for sh) read/eval

sc1068.description: Don't put spaces around the = in assignments.

sc1069.description: You need a space before the [.

sc1070.description: Parsing stopped here. Mismatched keywords or invalid parentheses?

sc1071.description: ShellCheck only supports sh/bash/dash/ksh scripts. Sorry!

sc1073.description: Couldn't parse this (thing). Fix to allow more checks.

sc1077.description: For command expansion, the tick should slant left (` vs Â´).

sc1078.description: Did you forget to close this double quoted string?

sc1079.description: This is actually an end quote, but due to next char it looks suspect.

sc1081.description: Scripts are case sensitive. Use 'if', not 'If'.

sc1082.description: This file has a UTF-8 BOM. Remove it with: LC_CTYPE=C sed '1s/^...//' < yourscript .

sc1083.description: This `{`/`}` is literal. Check expression (missing `;/\n?`) or quote it.

sc1086.description: Don't use $ on the iterator name in for loops.

sc1087.description: "Use braces when expanding arrays, e.g. ${array[idx]} (or ${var}[.. to quiet)."

sc1088.description: Parsing stopped here. Invalid use of parentheses?

sc1089.description: Parsing stopped here. Is this keyword correctly matched up?

sc1090.description: Can't follow non-constant source. Use a directive to specify location.

sc1094.description: Parsing of sourced file failed. Ignoring it.

sc1095.description: You need a space or linefeed between the function name and body.

sc1097.description: Unexpected ==. For assignment, use =. For comparison, use [/[[.

sc1098.description: Quote/escape special characters when using eval, e.g. eval "a=(b)".

sc1099.description: You need a space before the #.

sc1100.description: This is a unicode dash. Delete and retype as ASCII minus.

sc1101.description: Delete trailing spaces after \ to break line (or use quotes for literal space).

sc1102.description: Shells disambiguate `$((` differently or not at all. For `$(command substition)`, add space after `$(` . For `$((arithmetics))`, fix parsing errors.

sc1104.description: Use #!, not just !, for the shebang.

sc1105.description: Shells disambiguate (( differently or not at all. If the first ( should start a subshell, add a space after it.

sc1107.description: This directive is unknown. It will be ignored.

sc1108.description: You need a space before and after the = .

sc1109.description: This is an unquoted HTML entity. Replace with corresponding character.

sc1110.description: This is a unicode quote. Delete and retype it (or quote to make literal).

sc1111.description: This is a unicode quote. Delete and retype it (or ignore/singlequote for literal).

sc1112.description: This is a unicode quote. Delete and retype it (or ignore/doublequote for literal).

sc1113.description: Use #!, not just #, for the shebang.

sc1114.description: Remove leading spaces before the shebang.

sc1115.description: Remove spaces between # and ! in the shebang.

sc1116.description: Missing $ on a $((..)) expression? (or use ( ( for arrays).

sc1117.description: Backslash is literal in `"\n"`. Prefer explicit escaping: `"\\n"`.

sc1118.description: Delete whitespace after the here-doc end token.

sc1119.description: Add a linefeed between end token and terminating ')'.

sc1120.description: No comments allowed after here-doc token. Comment the next line instead.

sc1121.description: Add ;/& terminators (and other syntax) on the line with the <<, not here.

sc1122.description: Nothing allowed after end token. To continue a command, put it on the line with the `<<`.

sc1123.description: ShellCheck directives are only valid in front of complete compound commands, like `if`, not e.g. individual `elif` branches.

sc1124.description: ShellCheck directives are only valid in front of complete commands like 'case' statements, not individual case branches.

sc1126.description: Place shellcheck directives before commands, not after.

sc1127.description: Was this intended as a comment? Use `#` in sh.

sc1128.description: The shebang must be on the first line. Delete blanks and move comments.

sc1129.description: You need a space before the !.

sc1130.description: You need a space before the :.

sc1132.description: This `&` terminates the command. Escape it or add space after `&` to silence.

sc1133.description: Unexpected start of line. If breaking lines, |/||/&& should be at the end of the previous one.

sc1135.description: Prefer escape over ending quote to make `$` literal. Instead of `"It costs $"5`, use `"It costs \$5"`

sc1136.description: Unexpected characters after terminating `]`. Missing semicolon/linefeed?

sc2000.description: See if you can use ${#variable} instead

sc2001.description: SC2001: See if you can use ${variable//search/replace} instead.

sc2002.description: Useless cat. Consider 'cmd < file | ..' or 'cmd file | ..' instead.

sc2003.description: expr is antiquated. Consider rewriting this using $((..)), ${} or \[\[ \]\].

sc2006.description: Use `$(...)` notation instead of legacy backticked `` `...` ``.

sc2008.description: echo doesn't read from stdin, are you sure you should be piping to it?

sc2009.description: SC2009 Consider using pgrep instead of grepping ps output.

sc2010.description: Don't use ls | grep. Use a glob or a for loop with a condition to allow non-alphanumeric filenames.

sc2011.description: Use `find -print0` or `find -exec` to better handle non-alphanumeric filenames.

sc2012.description: Use `find` instead of `ls` to better handle non-alphanumeric filenames.

sc2013.description: To read lines rather than words, pipe/redirect to a 'while read' loop.

sc2014.description: This will expand once before find runs, not per file found.

sc2015.description: Note that A && B || C is not if-then-else. C may run when A is true.

sc2016.description: Expressions don't expand in single quotes, use double quotes for that.

sc2017.description: Increase precision by replacing a/b\*c with a\*c/b.

sc2018.description: Use '[:lower:]' to support accents and foreign alphabets.

sc2019.description: Use '[:upper:]' to support accents and foreign alphabets.

sc2020.description: tr replaces sets of chars, not words (mentioned due to duplicates).

sc2021.description: Don't use [] around ranges in tr, it replaces literal square brackets.

sc2022.description: Note that unlike globs, o* here matches 'ooo' but not 'oscar'

sc2024.description: `sudo` doesn't affect redirects. Use `..| sudo tee file`

sc2025.description: Make sure all escape sequences are enclosed in `\[..\]` to prevent line wrapping issues

sc2026.description: This word is outside of quotes. Did you intend to `'nest '"'single quotes'"'` instead'?

sc2027.description: The surrounding quotes actually unquote this. Remove or escape them.

sc2028.description: echo won't expand escape sequences. Consider printf.

sc2029.description: Note that, unescaped, this expands on the client side.

sc2030.description: Modification of var is local (to subshell caused by pipeline).

sc2031.description: var was modified in a subshell. That change might be lost.

sc2032.description: Use own script or sh -c '..' to run this from su.

sc2033.description: Shell functions can't be passed to external commands.

sc2034.description: foo appears unused. Verify it or export it.

sc2035.description: Use ./\*glob* or -- \*glob* so names with dashes won't become options.

sc2036.description: If you wanted to assign the output of the pipeline, use a=$(b | c) .

sc2037.description: To assign the output of a command, use var=$(cmd) .

sc2038.description: Use -print0/-0 or find -exec + to allow for non-alphanumeric filenames.

sc2040.description: !/bin/sh was specified, so ____ is not supported, even when sh is actually bash.

sc2041.description: This is a literal string. To run as a command, use $(..) instead of '..' .

sc2043.description: This loop will only ever run once for a constant value. Did you perhaps mean to loop over dir/*, $var or $(cmd)?"

sc2044.description: For loops over find output are fragile. Use find -exec or a while read loop.

sc2045.description: Iterating over ls output is fragile. Use globs.

sc2046.description: Quote this to prevent word splitting

sc2048.description: Use "$@" (with quotes) to prevent whitespace problems.

sc2049.description: =~ is for regex, but this looks like a glob. Use = instead.

sc2050.description: This expression is constant. Did you forget the `$` on a variable?

sc2051.description: Bash doesn't support variables in brace range expansions.

sc2053.description: Quote the rhs of = in [[ ]] to prevent glob matching.

sc2054.description: Use spaces, not commas, to separate array elements.

sc2055.description: You probably wanted && here, otherwise it's always true.

sc2059.description: Don't use variables in the printf format string. Use printf "..%s.." "$foo".

sc2060.description: Quote parameters to tr to prevent glob expansion.

sc2061.description: Quote the parameter to -name so the shell won't interpret it.

sc2062.description: Quote the grep pattern so the shell won't interpret it.

sc2063.description: Grep uses regex, but this looks like a glob.

sc2064.description: Use single quotes, otherwise this expands now rather than when signalled.

sc2065.description: This is interpreted as a shell file redirection, not a comparison.

sc2066.description: Since you double quoted this, it will not word split, and the loop will only run once.

sc2067.description: Missing ';' or + terminating -exec. You can't use |/||/&&, and ';' has to be a separate, quoted argument.

sc2068.description: Double quote array expansions to avoid re-splitting elements.

sc2069.description: To redirect stdout+stderr, 2>&1 must be last (or use '{ cmd > file; } 2>&1' to clarify).

sc2070.description: `-n` doesn't work with unquoted arguments. Quote or use ``[[ ]]``.

sc2071.description: > is for string comparisons. Use -gt instead.

sc2072.description: Decimals are not supported. Either use integers only, or use bc or awk to compare.

sc2073.description: Escape `\<` to prevent it redirecting (or switch to `[[ .. ]]`).

sc2076.description: Don't quote rhs of =~, it'll match literally rather than as a regex.

sc2077.description: You need spaces around the comparison operator.

sc2078.description: This expression is constant. Did you forget a `$` somewhere?

sc2079.description: (( )) doesn't support decimals. Use bc or awk.

sc2080.description: Numbers with leading 0 are considered octal.

sc2081.description: `[ .. ]` can't match globs. Use `[[ .. ]]` or grep.

sc2082.description: To expand via indirection, use name="foo$n"; echo "${!name}".

sc2084.description: Remove '$' or use '_=$((expr))' to avoid executing output.

sc2086.description: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.

sc2087.description: Quote 'EOF' to make here document expansions happen on the server side rather than on the client.

sc2088.description: Tilde does not expand in quotes. Use $HOME.

sc2089.description: Quotes/backslashes will be treated literally. Use an array.

sc2090.description: Quotes/backslashes in this variable will not be respected.

sc2091.description: Remove surrounding $() to avoid executing output.

sc2092.description: Remove backticks to avoid executing output.

sc2093.description: Remove "exec " if script should continue after this command.

sc2094.description: SC2094 Make sure not to read and write the same file in the same pipeline.

sc2095.description: Use ssh -n to prevent ssh from swallowing stdin.

sc2096.description: On most OS, shebangs can only specify a single parameter.

sc2097.description: This assignment is only seen by the forked process.

sc2098.description: This expansion will not see the mentioned assignment.

sc2102.description: Ranges can only match single chars (mentioned due to duplicates).

sc2103.description: Use a ( subshell ) to avoid having to cd back.

sc2104.description: In functions, use return instead of break.

sc2106.description: SC2106: This only exits the subshell caused by the pipeline.

sc2107.description: Instead of [ a && b ], use [ a ] && [ b ].

sc2109.description: Instead of [ a || b ], use [ a ] || [ b ].

sc2115.description: Use "${var:?}" to ensure this never expands to /* .

sc2116.description: SC2116 Useless echo? Instead of 'cmd $(echo foo)', just use 'cmd foo'.

sc2117.description: To run commands as another user, use su -c or sudo.

sc2119.description: Use foo "$@" if function's $1 should mean script's $1.

sc2120.description: foo references arguments, but none are ever passed.

sc2121.description: To assign a variable, use just 'var=value', no 'set ..'.

sc2122.description: >= is not a valid operator. Use '! a < b' instead.

sc2123.description: PATH is the shell search path. Use another name.

sc2124.description: Assigning an array to a string! Assign as array, or use * instead of @ to concatenate.

sc2125.description: Brace expansions and globs are literal in assignments. Quote it or use an array.

sc2128.description: Expanding an array without an index only gives the first element.

sc2129.description: Consider using { cmd1; cmd2; } >> file instead of individual redirects.

sc2130.description: -eq is for integer comparisons. Use = instead.

sc2139.description: This expands when defined, not when used. Consider escaping.

sc2140.description: Word is on the form "A"B"C" (B indicated). Did you mean "ABC" or "A\\"B\\"C"?

sc2142.description: Aliases can't use positional parameters. Use a function.

sc2143.description: Use grep -q instead of comparing output with [ -n .. ].

sc2144.description: -e doesn't work with globs. Use a for loop.

sc2145.description: Argument mixes string and array. Use * or separate argument.

sc2146.description: This action ignores everything before the -o. Use \\( \\) to group.

sc2147.description: Literal tilde in PATH works poorly across programs.

sc2148.description: Add a shebang line to the top of your script:

sc2149.description: Remove $/${} for numeric index, or escape it for string.

sc2150.description: -exec does not automatically invoke a shell. Use -exec sh -c .. for that.

sc2151.description: Only one integer 0-255 can be returned. Use stdout for other data.

sc2152.description: Can only return 0-255. Other data should be written to stdout.

sc2153.description: Possible Misspelling: MYVARIABLE may not be assigned, but MY_VARIABLE is.

sc2154.description: var is referenced but not assigned.

sc2155.description: Declare and assign separately to avoid masking return values.

sc2156.description: Injecting filenames is fragile and insecure. Use parameters.

sc2157.description: Argument to implicit -n is always true due to literal strings.

sc2158.description: [ false ] is true. Remove the brackets

sc2163.description: This does not export 'FOO'. Remove $/${} for that, or use ${var?} to quiet.

sc2164.description: Use cd ... || exit in case cd fails.

sc2165.description: This nested loop overrides the index variable of its parent.

sc2166.description: Prefer [ p ] && [ q ] as [ p -a q ] is not well defined.

sc2167.description: This parent loop has its index variable overridden.

sc2170.description: Numerical -eq does not dereference in [..]. Expand or use string operator.

sc2171.description: Found trailing ] outside test. Add missing [ or quote if intentional.

sc2172.description: Trapping signals by number is not well defined. Prefer signal names.

sc2174.description: When used with -p, -m only applies to the deepest directory.

sc2175.description: Quote this invalid brace expansion since it should be passed literally to eval

sc2176.description: 'time' is undefined for pipelines. time single stage or bash -c instead.

sc2177.description: 'time' is undefined for compound commands, time sh -c instead.

sc2178.description: Variable was used as an array but is now assigned a string.

sc2179.description: Use array+=("item") to append items to an array.

sc2180.description: Bash does not support multidimensional arrays. Use 1D or associative arrays.

sc2181.description: Check exit code directly with e.g. 'if mycmd;', not indirectly with $?.

sc2182.description: This printf format string has no variables. Other arguments are ignored.

sc2183.description: This format string has 2 variables, but is passed 1 arguments.

sc2184.description: Quote arguments to unset so they're not glob expanded.

sc2185.description: Some finds don't have a default path. Specify '.' explicitly.

sc2186.description: tempfile is deprecated. Use mktemp instead.

sc2187.description: Ash scripts will be checked as Dash. Add '# shellcheck shell=dash' to silence.

sc2188.description: This redirection doesn't have a command. Move to its command (or use 'true' as no-op).

sc2189.description: You can't have | between this redirection and the command it should apply to.

sc2190.description: Elements in associative arrays need index, e.g. array=( [index]=value ) .

sc2191.description: The = here is literal. To assign by index, use ( [index]=value ) with no spaces. To keep as literal, quote it.

sc2192.description: This array element has no value. Remove spaces after = or use "" for empty string.

sc2193.description: The arguments to this comparison can never be equal. Make sure your syntax is correct.

sc2194.description: This word is constant. Did you forget the $ on a variable?

sc2195.description: This pattern will never match the case statement's word. Double check them.

sc2196.description: egrep is non-standard and deprecated. Use grep -E instead.

sc2197.description: fgrep is non-standard and deprecated. Use grep -F instead.

sc2198.description: Arrays don't work as operands in [ ]. Use a loop (or concatenate with * instead of @).

sc2199.description: Arrays implicitly concatenate in `[[ ]]`. Use a loop (or explicit * instead of @).

sc2200.description: Brace expansions don't work as operands in [ ]. Use a loop.

sc2201.description: Brace expansion doesn't happen in `[[ ]]`. Use a loop.

sc2202.description: Globs don't work as operands in [ ]. Use a loop.

sc2203.description: Globs are ignored in `[[ ]]` except right of =/!=. Use a loop.

sc2204.description: (..) is a subshell. Did you mean [ .. ], a test expression?

sc2205.description: (..) is a subshell. Did you mean [ .. ], a test expression?

sc2206.description: Quote to prevent word splitting/globbing, or split robustly with mapfile or read -a.

sc2207.description: Prefer mapfile or read -a to split command output (or quote to avoid splitting).

sc2208.description: Use `[[ ]]` or quote arguments to -v to avoid glob expansion.

sc2209.description: Use var=$(command) to assign output (or quote to assign string).

sc2210.description: This is a file redirection. Was it supposed to be a comparison or fd operation?

sc2211.description: This is a glob used as a command name. Was it supposed to be in ${..}, array, or is it missing quoting?

sc2213.description: getopts specified -n, but it's not handled by this 'case'.

sc2214.description: This case is not specified by getopts.

sc2215.description: This flag is used as a command name. Bad line break or missing `[ .. ]`?

sc2216.description: Piping to 'rm', a command that doesn't read stdin. Wrong command or missing xargs?

sc2217.description: Redirecting to 'echo', a command that doesn't read stdin. Bad quoting or missing xargs?

sc2218.description: This function is only defined later. Move the definition up.

sc2220.description: Invalid flags are not handled. Add a `*)` case.

sc2221.description: This pattern always overrides a later one.

sc2222.description: This pattern never matches because of a previous pattern.

sc2223.description: This default assignment may cause DoS due to globbing. Quote it.

sc2224.description: This mv has no destination. Check the arguments.

sc2225.description: This cp has no destination. Check the arguments.

sc2226.description: This ln has no destination. Check the arguments, or specify '.' explicitly.

sc2227.description: Redirection applies to the find command itself. Rewrite to work per action (or move to end).

sc2229.description: This does not read 'foo'. Remove $/${} for that, or use ${var?} to quiet.

sc2230.description: which is non-standard. Use builtin 'command -v' instead.

sc2231.description: Quote expansions in this for loop glob to prevent wordsplitting, e.g. "$dir"/*.txt .

sc2232.description: Can't use sudo with builtins like cd. Did you want sudo sh -c .. instead?

sc2235.description: Use `{ ..; }` instead of `(..)` to avoid subshell overhead.

sc2238.description: Redirecting to/from command name instead of file. Did you want pipes/xargs (or quote to ignore)?

sc2239.description: Ensure the shebang uses the absolute path to the interpreter.

sc2240.description: The dot command does not support arguments in sh/dash. Set them as variables.

sc2241.description: The exit status can only be one integer 0-255. Use stdout for other data.

sc2242.description: Can only exit with status 0-255. Other data should be written to stdout/stderr.

sc2243.description: Prefer explicit -n to check for output (or run command without [/[[ to check for success)

sc2244.description: Prefer explicit -n to check non-empty string (or use =/-ne to check boolean/integer).

sc2245.description: -d only applies to the first expansion of this glob. Use a loop to check any/all.

sc2246.description: This shebang specifies a directory. Ensure the interpreter is a file.

sc2247.description: Flip leading $ and " if this should be a quoted substitution.

sc2248.description: Warn about variable references without braces.

sc2249.description: Consider adding a default *) case, even if it just exits with error.

sc2250.description: Prefer putting braces around variable references even when not strictly required.

sc2251.description: This ! is not on a condition and skips errexit. Use `&& exit 1` instead, or make sure $? is checked.

sc2252.description: You probably wanted && here, otherwise it's always true.

sc2253.description: Use -R to recurse, or explicitly a-r to remove read permissions.

sc2254.description: Quote expansions in case patterns to match literally rather than as a glob.

sc2255.description: `[ ]` does not apply arithmetic evaluation. Evaluate with `$((..))` for numbers, or use string comparator for strings.

sc2256.description: This translated string is the name of a variable. Flip leading $ and " if this should be a quoted substitution.

sc2257.description: Arithmetic modifications in command redirections may be discarded. Do them separately.

sc2259.description: This redirection overrides piped input. To use both, merge or pass filenames.

sc2260.description: This redirection overrides the output pipe. Use 'tee' to output to both.

sc2261.description: Multiple redirections compete for stdout. Use cat, tee, or pass filenames instead.

sc2262.description: This alias can't be defined and used in the same parsing unit. Use a function instead.
